Articles.Content:
My single greatest achievement?

I would probably have to say my manned landing and return from Pol, since that is my current distance (and time) record for farthest (and longest) manned land-and-return mission to another body.
My greatest achievement was in stealing the parts bin keys, and locking the Kerbish OSHA representative in the bathroom.

Beeing able to land at KSC with any lander, even managed once to land on top of the KCS building itself, but in general my landings nowerdays end within the the complex itself, without the help of any autopilot system.

It took me ages before i figured it out how to do it, YT tutorials all gave different results on how to do it, still my landings where off by miles, but when i finally got the hang of it, i felt i really accomplished something, even more as it was when i mastered docking, what was for me at least alot easier to learn as pinpoint landings on a atmospheric planet.

Everything else wasnt (at least for me) not as hard to learn as this..
Errm my best ksp achievement is... A mun landing... I know, I suck, but hey, I only started playing about a month ago.

Probably the successful development of Ladderlift infinite travel frame technology.

Tada! Superlight Eve accents possible. Though you'd need a lander to get it safely down, and something different to get you home after you achieve orbit.

Javascript is disabled. View full album

Love the Eve ladder ascender! It just shows Kerbals can do anything if they set their mind to it.

I guess my 3 Kerbal Eve lander and ship is my greatest achievement to date.

For me, it was definitely creating a Tylo SSTO - a spaceplane capable of going to Tylo and back without refueling. It uses a detachable lander to descend to the surface, redock, and then the whole ship flies home. It has very small fuel margins though!

Click here to see my thread.
Landing on Laythe... Not in one piece because my ship pretty much flew apart when I splashed down and then my Kerbal got locked out of the capsule
My first moon landing career. No fuel margin and the dam thing tipped over ( I got it back up using my magnometer boom!)

My greatest achievement in terms of lols is: http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=254724212

Minmus + mainsail ditch+ super slow descent = Lols

So far, my biggest achievements:

  • Visiting every planet/moon surface with something (probe, or manned)
  • Satellites around every planet/moon
  • Manned landing + return, Tylo
  • Manned landing + return, Eve
  • Asteroids on display at KSC, in front of the astronaut complex
  • Manual landing of a lander at KSC (no Mechjeb landing), while on a Munar return trajectory, and almost no fuel (so getting into a proper orbit first was not possible).

Man, all this crazy impressive stuff. Feeling like a noob now.

My biggest achievement was just today. Lined up for my first successful asteroid capture... and was already on my way to rendezvous when I realized that instead of the little B class I thought I was going after, I'd somehow tracked a behemoth E class instead. My heavy capture ship had something like 6000dv when it got there, and it took pretty much every last drop of fuel I had to manage the capture... but I did it!

Especially proud of this since I had no idea what I was in for (this was literally my first time grappling anything with the claw) and right off the bat started the rock spinning like crazy. Had to re-grab it a few times until I figured out how to maneuver it.
Landing a probe on the darkside of Eeloo, 1st time sucsessful

1. Made an SSTO

2. Put space stations around 3 of Jool's moons(2 more to go)

3. Landed on Eve and returned
Going to Laythe and Duna...but used Infinite Fuel to do so I'm working on going to all the bodies legitly

For me, the feel of gratest achievement was landing the first time on the MÃƒÂ¼n, short after I learned how orbits works. I had to land on winglets because there was no landing legs in KSP at that time (I think it was in 0.14). Also, I was listeting walking on the moon by The Police.

Also, landing on Minmus Apollo style, and make a rover entirely on Minmus surface with parts storaged in 4 KAS cages.
Landing a heavy rover on Minmus and traveling almost a quarter of its radius without side rolling. Quite an achievement for me, I'm not a very good driver/pilot.

Most of us are probably very proud of something they did in KSP. I'm proud of the time when I orbited the Mun, flew past Minmus, and then finally landed close to the northern ice cap. What is your proudest moment in KSP?
Finally got Jeb on the Mun! In tutorial mode... ! After I blew up the lander... And had him jump out before impact.
"Holy [expletive], it's in orbit and it didn't get there in several pieces!"

First rescue mission. In Mun's orbit:D. I had to pick up a Kerbal that was thrown by bug off his lander during EVA. I managed to establish stable-ish orbit with his jetpack, but it was insanely inclined, highly elliptical, and closest rescue craft was still in VAB. That mission was more nerve-wracking than my first landing on Duna, but i felt so proud when rescuee was finally brought back home

manned mission to Eve... everything was planned... Scanned Eve to find a good place to land... Eve launcher was developed to work at sea lvl... 2 kerbals landed on Eve and returned... all stock...

Javascript is disabled. View full album
Minmus Extreme EVA. Ie land and return to orbit by EVA. That was actually my first Minmus landing too.

Proudest moments would have to be first landing on Duna and the subsequent rescue mission to get my stranded Kerbal. Holy crap that first landing was a trip. I was sweating bullets trying to conserve fuel by waiting till the parachutes fully deployed to gauge how much power I'd have to use on landing. The size of the planet coupled with the thin atmosphere made that pretty nerve racking.

The rescue mission went quite well, and even had the extra fuel to stop by (and land on) Ike for a minute, but it was also my first interplanetary trip with a successful return.
